alert.note: Alert for Coos (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 8:45AM PST until January 08 at 8:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Coquille River at Coquille affecting Coos County. For the Coquille River...including Coquille...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. The river is forecast to rise above flood stage again this afternoon with high tide around 547 PM PST. It is forecast to then fall below flood stage later this evening. * WHERE...Coquille River at Coquille. * WHEN...Until 8 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, The Coquille River is at flood stage. Expect flooding of farmland and low-lying areas throughout the flood plain along the Coquille River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM PST Saturday the stage was 20.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 21.1 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.1 feet on 01/01/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 800 PM PST.
